result.execSummary:
The defendant George Alton Ridyard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. George Alton Ridyard is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • George Alton Ridyard was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:47 PM Defendant George Alton Ridyard in court with attorney Amy M Johnson. Prosecuting Atty Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for State of Wisconsin.    Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 


On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count 1  . 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT 2 
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 30 days  in Dane County Jail, with Huber; cs 22CM1033

-Days credit for time served:  14 days
-Days credit to jail:  14 days

COURT COSTS:
Ct 2
-DA surcharge
-DNA surcharge waived
-All CC, DA surcharge due w/in 60 days. 


-Bond posted to be applied to fines and cc only and remainder returned to poster.


-The Court orders DNA sample

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

01:36 PM- IN CUSTODY 

Defendant George Alton Ridyard in court with attorney Amy M Johnson. Prosecuting Atty Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin. Hearing regarding PTS Violations. ADA Rennicke's position on bail. States victim would like the bond to allow contact. Atty Johnson's position on bail. DE would like contact with DE. CT: Atty Johnson to go talk with ADA Demarco to see if resolution can be reached. ADA Demarco unable to attend today/Friday's hearing. CT states someone with authority to make an offer needs to appear at the STC scheduled on 7/29 or CT will consider dismissing case. CT: reinstates current cash bail and increases bail by $100 per case w/ referral to DCPS. Condition of "Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Sandra D." modified to "No acts or threats of violence towards Sandra D." All other conditions to remain the same. DE to comply with PTS. DE's appearance waived at 7/29/22 Hearing but needs to be available by phone so his atty can contact him.

04:14 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.
